snippet: Not allowed by law to steam away for overnight cruises and no longer entirely welcome at its dock downtown, the Delta Queen is now an issue before Congress and a sensitive matter for Chattanooga’s new mayor.
abstract: Delta Queen, historic riverboat that once roamed Mississippi and its tributaries, sits moored on banks of Tennessee River in Chattanooga, where it has remained since 2009 as floating hotel; backers want to see riverboat back in service, putting issue before Congress and creating sensitive matter for Chattanooga Mayor Andy Berke.
lead_paragraph: Not allowed by law to steam away for overnight cruises and no longer entirely welcome at its dock downtown, the Delta Queen is now an issue before Congress and a sensitive matter for Chattanooga’s new mayor.

headline.seo: Riverboat’s Backers Look for a Way to Get the Delta Queen Moving Again
headline.main: A Historic Vessel, Stuck in Place
headline.print_headline: A Historic Vessel, Stuck in Place
